Package planeair.util

Class Coordinate

java.lang.Object
org.jxmapviewer.viewer.GeoPosition
planeair.util.Coordinate
public class Coordinate extends org.jxmapviewer.viewer.GeoPosition
This class extends GeoPosition, from JxMapViewer, but takes care of the direction char ('N', 'E'...) that are stored in the source File. The final values of the Coordinate are stored as doubles, but they can be rendered as beautiful Strings like : 12Â° 12' 12'' S | 1Â° 1' 1'' E
Author:
Luc le Manifik

  • Constructor Details

    • Coordinate

      public Coordinate(int latDegree, int latMinutes, int latSeconds, char latDirection, int lonDegree, int lonMinutes, int lonSeconds, char lonDirection) throws InvalidCoordinateException
      Creates a new Coordinate. Extends GeoPosition, so it can be used with JXMapViewer and contains both Latitude and Longitude values.
      Parameters:
      latDegree - The latitude degree
      latMinutes - The latitude minutes
      latSeconds - The latitude seconds
      latDirection - The latitude direction ('N' or 'S')
      lonDegree - The longitude degree
      lonMinutes - The longitude minutes
      lonSeconds - The longitude seconds
      lonDirection - The longitude direction ('E' or 'O')
      Throws:
      InvalidCoordinateException - Threw if the Coordinate read in the source File is not correct
